de.susebox.jtopas.spi
Interface KeywordHandler

All Known Subinterfaces:
DataMapper
All Known Implementing Classes:
StandardKeywordHandler, StandardTokenizerProperties
public interface KeywordHandler

This interface must be implemented by classes that should be used as a keyword handler for a Tokenizer.

Author:
Heiko Blau
See Also:
Tokenizer, TokenizerProperties, DataMapper

Method Summary
 boolean hasKeywords()
          This method can be used by a Tokenizer implementation for a fast detection if keyword matching must be performed at all.
 TokenizerProperty isKeyword(DataProvider dataProvider)
          This method checks if the character range given through the DataProvider comprises a keyword.
 

Method Detail

hasKeywords

public boolean hasKeywords()
This method can be used by a Tokenizer implementation for a fast detection if keyword matching must be performed at all. If the method returns false time-consuming preparations can be skipped.

Returns:
true if there actually are pattern that can be tested for a match, false otherwise.

isKeyword

public TokenizerProperty isKeyword(DataProvider dataProvider)
                            throws TokenizerException,
                                   java.lang.NullPointerException
This method checks if the character range given through the DataProvider comprises a keyword. An implementation should use a TokenizerException to report problems.

Parameters:
dataProvider - the source to get the data from, that are checked
Returns:
a TokenizerProperty if a keyword could be found, null otherwise
Throws:
TokenizerException - generic exception
java.lang.NullPointerException - if no DataProvider is given
